summary: This document is an email chain from April 2019 discussing the identification of potential victim witnesses from old Epstein case files (302s and grand jury testimony). The correspondents are coordinating a meeting to discuss which individuals to engage, noting some were significant due to age or conduct beyond massages.

events.title: Email coordination on victim witnesses
events.description: Email exchange discussing scheduling a meeting to talk about potential Epstein victim witnesses identified from old case files.

events.title: Initial identification of victim witnesses
events.description: An email was sent identifying names from old Epstein 302s and grand jury testimony as potentially significant victim witnesses, based on factors like age and conduct beyond massages.

keyFacts: The email chain is from April 2019, indicating ongoing review of the Epstein case years after initial investigations.
The correspondents identified potential victim witnesses from old Epstein FBI 302s and grand jury testimony.
Selection criteria for these witnesses included the victim's age and conduct described as 'well beyond massages'.
The discussion involves deciding which of these identified individuals to attempt to engage.
The document originates from or involves the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
